block.p: Dr. Shelley Dawn Clark, a demographer, and Prof. Jacob Thomas Levy, a political scientist, were married yesterday in a Quaker ceremony in the Hall of Philosophy at the Chautauqua Institution in Chautauqua, N.Y.

Dr. Clark, 28, will keep her name. She is a program associate at the Population Council in New York, where she works on women's reproductive health issues in developing countries. The bride is a graduate of the University of Virginia. She received master's and Ph.D. degrees in public affairs and demography from Princeton University, where she met the bridegroom.

Dr. Shelley Dawn Clark, a demographer, and Prof. Jacob Thomas Levy, a political scientist, were married yesterday in a Quaker ceremony in the Hall of Philosophy at the Chautauqua Institution in Chautauqua, N.Y.

Dr. Clark, 28, will keep her name. She is a program associate at the Population Council in New York, where she works on women's reproductive health issues in developing countries. The bride is a graduate of the University of Virginia. She received master's and Ph.D. degrees in public affairs and demography from Princeton University, where she met the bridegroom.

Her father, Harry F. Clark of North East, Pa., is the world cultures teacher at North East High School. Her mother, Diane K. Clark of Fredonia, N.Y., who is retired, taught the third grade at the Bush Elementary School in Jamestown, N.Y.

Professor Levy, 29, is an assistant professor of political science at the University of Chicago. He is the author of ''The Multiculturalism of Fear'' (Oxford University Press, 2000). He graduated magna cum laude from Brown and was a Fulbright scholar at the Australian Defense Force Academy, where he studied Aboriginal land rights. He also received a Ph.D. in politics from Princeton. He is a son of Darby J. Healey of Portsmouth, N.H., who is an accounts supervisor at the Timberland Corporation, the maker of shoes and outdoor equipment in Stratham, N.H.
